name: Lamb Puff Pastry Bite Appetizer
author: The Flying Shepard
summary: Bring lamb to your next holiday meal! This is a quick and easy way to impress your family with a delicious appetizer. This recipe is best if domestic lamb is used, as it is much more mild and flavorful than imported lamb. The spices are the typical spices used in Mediterranean cooking of lamb.
ingredients: 2  (10x15-inch) sheets of frozen puff pastry, thawed
directions: Mix garlic, salt, pepper, cumin, coriander, and allspice together in a bowl; add lamb
Form lamb mixture into 10-inch logs the thickness of hot dogs
Whisk egg and water together in a small bowl to make egg wash
Lay puff pastry sheets on a lightly floured work surface; roll gently to smooth the creases
Place 1 lamb log on each strip of pastry; wrap dough around lamb and pinch edges to seal
Wrap in plastic wrap and chill for 1 hour
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Remove plastic wrap and slice each piece of pastry into 8 pieces with a sharp knife
Arrange in a single layer on the lined baking sheet
Brush each piece with egg wash
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 20 minutes
